analyzed: shes @122b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya dgu pa //
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya dgu pa //
translated: Volume 209

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang sems can gang ji snyed cig gdags pas gdags su yod pa /🔽gzugs yod pa'am gzugs med pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang sems can gang ji snyed cig gdags pas gdags su yod pa / gzugs yod pa'am gzugs med pa'am /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, however many beings there are who are designated by designation,🔽whether they have form or are formless,

original: 'du shes yod pa'am 'du shes med pa'am /
analyzed: 'du shes yod pa'am 'du shes med pa'am /
translated: whether they have perception or are without perception,

original: 'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: neither with perception nor without perception,

original: 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin pa 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dang / phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag gi'ang rung ste /🔽de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas sems bsdus pa dang spros par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin pa 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dang / phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag gi'ang rung ste / de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas sems bsdus pa dang spros par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang / spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: whether in this world system or in all the world systems in the ten directions,🔽the Tathāgata knows them as they really are.🔽“Subhūti, how does the Tathāgata know the contracted and expanded thoughts of those beings as they really are?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni chos nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni chos nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata knows the contracted and expanded thoughts of those beings as they really are by means of the true nature of dharmas.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa chos nyid gang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das; de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa chos nyid gang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Blessed One, by what Dharma-nature do the Thus-Gone One’s know the minds of those beings, whether they are concentrated or distracted, in accordance with reality?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni chos nyid gang la chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni chos nyid gang la chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is by that Dharma-nature in which even the nature of phenomena is not observed,

original: sems bsdus pa dang spros pa lta smos kyang mi smos pa'i chos nyid des /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de @123a *//🔽dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems bsdus pa dang spros pa lta smos kyang mi smos pa'i chos nyid des / de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de @123a *// dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: let alone the concentration or distraction of the mind.🔽By that Dharma-nature, the Thus-Gone One knows the minds of those beings, whether they are concentrated or distracted, in accordance with reality.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha knows the minds of those beings, whether they are concentrated or distracted, in accordance with reality.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni zad pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na / rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni zad pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Subhuti : How does the Tathagata know the contracted and distracted thought of beings as it really is?🔽The Lord : The Tathagata knows the contracted and distracted thought of beings as it really is, as a thought which is exhausted,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: as a thought which is free from greed.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni 'gog pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs @123b pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni spong ba'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni 'gog pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs @123b pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni spong ba'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, knows as it really is the contraction and expansion of the mind of those beings in terms of cessation.🔽Subhuti, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, knows as it really is the contraction and expansion of the mind of those beings in terms of abandonment.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni zhi ba'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni zhi ba'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, knows as it really is the contraction and expansion of the mind of those beings in terms of peace.

original: rab 'byor; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni dben pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa ni dben pa'i rnam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sems can de dag gi sems bsdus pa dang spros pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Subhūti, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas know perfectly, just as it is, the minds of those beings that are contracted or distracted as being isolated.🔽Subhūti, in that way the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas know perfectly, just as it is, the minds of those beings that are contracted or distracted.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas know perfectly, just as it is, the minds of those beings that are associated with desire as minds that are associated with desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind free from passion as a mind free from passion.

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang @124a *//🔽dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang @124a *// dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with aversion as a mind with aversion.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind free from aversion as a mind free from aversion.

original: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with confusion as a mind with confusion.

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems la gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems la gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind free from confusion as a mind free from confusion.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bgyi bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa
analyzed: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bgyi bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa
translated: How is it that the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas know the minds of those sentient beings that are associated with desire to be minds that are associated with desire,

original: lags / zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bgyi bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa lags /
analyzed: lags / zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bgyi bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa lags /
translated: and how is it that they know the minds that are associated with hatred to be minds that are associated with hatred,

original: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bgyi bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa lags /
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bgyi bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa lags /
translated: and how is it that they know the minds that are associated with confusion to be minds that are associated with confusion?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: a mind that is associated with desire is not the suchness of the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor / sems ni yang dag pa @124b ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems ni yang dag pa @124b ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med do //
translated: Subhūti, mind is not apprehended as it really is.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med na /🔽'dod chags dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med na / 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am /
translated: If dharmas that are mental constituents are not apprehended,🔽how much less so a mind with passion

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems dmigs pa lta ci zhig smos /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems dmigs pa lta ci zhig smos /
translated: or a mind without passion!

original: rab 'byor / sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, a mind with aversion is not the suchness of mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / sems ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med de /
translated: Subhūti, mind is not apprehended as it really is.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med na /🔽sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med na / sems zhe sdang dang bcas pa'am /
translated: If dharmas that are mental constituents are not apprehended,🔽how much less so a mind with aversion

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems dmigs pa lta ci zhig smos /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems dmigs pa lta ci zhig smos /
translated: or a mind without aversion!

original: rab 'byor / sems gti mug dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems gti mug dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, a mind with confusion is not the suchness of mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / sems ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med de /
translated: Subhūti, mind is not apprehended as it really is.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang dmigs su med na /
translated: Since dharmas that arise from mind are not apprehended,

original: gti mug dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa'am /
translated: how much less could a mind with delusion or🔽a mind without delusion be apprehended!

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems dmigs pa lta ci zhig smos; de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems dmigs pa lta ci zhig smos; de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
translated: In that way, the Tathāgata, having depended on this perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: correctly knows the minds of those sentient beings that have desire as having desire.🔽He correctly knows the minds that have hatred as having hatred.

original: @125a *// gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: @125a *// gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He correctly knows the minds that have delusion as having delusion.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na; rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na; rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti, how do the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas know the minds of those sentient beings that are free from desire as ‘minds free from desire’?

original: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin /
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, a mind that is free from desire is not a mind that has desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not free from desire.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med de /🔽rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med de / rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la /
translated: Subhūti, two minds do not meet or join.🔽Subhūti, the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas know the minds of those sentient beings that are free from desire as ‘minds free from desire.’

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: “Subhūti, how do the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas know the minds of those sentient beings that are angry as ‘minds that are angry’?

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems zhe sdang dang bral ba la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems zhe sdang dang bral ba la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do tathāgatas accurately know the minds of those sentient beings that are free from anger as minds that are free from anger?

original: rab 'byor / sems zhe sdang dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems zhe sdang dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, a mind that is free from anger

original: sems kyi zhe sdang dang bcas pa nyid ma yin /
analyzed: sems kyi zhe sdang dang bcas pa nyid ma yin /
translated: is not a mind that is associated with anger.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not a mind that is free from anger.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med de /
translated: Subhūti, two minds do not accompany and meet each other.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs @125b pas sems can de dag gi sems zhe sdang dang bral ba la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs @125b pas sems can de dag gi sems zhe sdang dang bral ba la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Subhūti, tathāgatas accurately know the minds of those sentient beings that are free from anger as minds that are free from anger.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems gti mug dang bral ba la gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems gti mug dang bral ba la gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do the tathāgatas, thanks to this deep perfection of wisdom, correctly know the minds of those beings as free from delusion, as minds free from delusion?

original: rab 'byor / sems gti mug dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems gti mug dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: “Subhūti, that mind free from delusion

original: sems kyi gti mug dang bcas pa nyid ma yin /
analyzed: sems kyi gti mug dang bcas pa nyid ma yin /
translated: is not a mind with delusion,

original: gti mug dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: and it is not free from delusion.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems gnyis 'grogs shing phrad pa med de /
translated: “Subhūti, two minds do not meet and join.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems gti mug dang bral ba la gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems gti mug dang bral ba la gti mug dang bral ba'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to; ;rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti, it is thus that the tathāgatas, thanks to this deep perfection of wisdom, correctly know the minds of those beings as free from delusion, as minds free from delusion.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brten te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the tathāgatas, thanks to this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi sems rgya che ba la /🔽sems rgya che zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi sems rgya che ba la / sems rgya che zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
translated: “The tathāgatas, thanks to this deep perfection of wisdom, know the vastness of the thought of other beings, of other persons, just as it is.

original: sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi sems rgya che ba la sems rgya che zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang gang zag pha rol gyi sems rgya che ba la sems rgya che zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do the tathāgatas, thanks to this deep perfection of wisdom, know the vastness of the thought of other beings, of other persons, just as it is?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs @126a *//🔽pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems de rgya che bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs @126a *// pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems de rgya che bar mi 'gyur /
translated: “Subhūti, here the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas do not see that thought of other beings, of other persons as vast,🔽do not see that thought of other beings, of other persons as not vast,

original: sems de rgya chung bar mi 'gyur /🔽sems de 'phel bar mi 'gyur /🔽sems de 'grib par mi 'gyur /🔽sems de 'ong bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems de rgya chung bar mi 'gyur / sems de 'phel bar mi 'gyur / sems de 'grib par mi 'gyur / sems de 'ong bar mi 'gyur /
translated: do not see that thought of other beings, of other persons as increasing,🔽do not see that thought of other beings, of other persons as decreasing,🔽do not see that thought of other beings, of other persons as coming,

original: sems de 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems de 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: do not see that thought of other beings, of other persons as going,
